ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course supplemented my Spanish skills in both speaking and writing. I was given the opportunity to expand the topics I discuss while speaking in spanish, which allowed my spanish speaking to be used/applied outside of the classroom setting.
I learned how to speak spanish
I got better at speaking Spanish. Specifically, I got a lot more confident speaking and at trying to convey complex ideas.
I expanded my cultural knowledge of Spanish speaking countries and my own ability to speak Spanish.

I learned about multiple aspects of Hispanic history, culture and language. My skills in speaking improved as I was able to sharpen my skills and certain parts of the grammar which i had no developed previously.
I learned Spanish.
I learned Spanish.
I became a lot more comfortable speaking Spanish!
I advanced my Spanish skills.
So much spanish!
improved comprehension and knowledge of Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I believe the course readings/videos/materials covered in this class were very interesting and applicable to the real world. However, it was fairly unorganized. Still, many of my assignments for the semester have not yet been graded, and there was often a lack of clarity about assignments in general.
it was fine

I felt like it had a very warm, welcoming atmosphere which made it easy to take risks and feel comfortable speaking out. (this is something I had struggled with in previous non-Yale Spanish classes, so I really appreciated it) I also appreciated the diversity of texts and films that we looked at. I didn't know any of the people in the class before I got there, and as a result I found it hard to coordinate with other people and make group projects that actually felt like a collaboration. I think this might be an inherent problem in a course like this, so I would suggest avoiding group projects, especially ones that need to be done at home.

I think language classes will always be a little bit of a drag when they meet everyday, but I think a way to improve this course is a greater emphasis on speaking in Spanish. My classmates did not participate in class discussions and to progress in speaking a language it is necessary to engage in constant conversation in the new language. I don't know whether that can be achieved by a really strict participation grade or by creating a more exciting atmosphere to talk but I think there needs to be less emphasis on written assignments or filling out handouts but just speaking constantly.
The strengths are the diverse topics we were shown. A weakness may be the lack of grammar we cover, which i feel would help me more.
Great class, just too early in the day.

Tends to have a lot of busy work, but thats expected in language classes since its all about consistent practice. Strengths are the frequent in class speaking practice you get with your peers. Super low stakes speaking practice with your friends is so helpful!
There was a lot of busy work. Too fast paced.
Strengths was Baffi! she rocks!
Class had too many students! it was hard for the prof to keep everyone engaged in lessons designed for a smaller class. Also, it would be better if everyone was not on their laptop (distracting).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Maybe if it were more organized, yes.
If you want to learn how to speak spanish then yes

Yes, this is a great course to practice Spanish. People come in with varying levels of experience, so I can't speak to whether it would be good for a particular student, but I thought it was a good course.
I wouldn't necessarily recommend but it is required to take a language lol and I do think Spanish is both an awesome and useful language.
Yes, definitely. I think its a big step from other levels of spanish where one will learn many new aspects. However, its a very doable level.
I would recommend that everyone learns Spanish any day.
Yes, if you want to learn Spanish it is great.
Yes! Language requirement is not fun, but Profesora Baffi is amazing and makes it worth your time.
No. I would only recommend this course if someone really really wanted to take Spanish.
YEs
yes, to complete language req. If possible, choose a section with fewer students...
